title: Pilot
synopsis: Michael decides to take a job in Arizona after being passed over by George Sr. for head of the Bluth Company. George Sr. is jailed, and the family realizes they need Michael.
fun_fact: This episode contains the first hint of Lucille's affair with Oscar in Gob's full name, "George Oscar Bluth."

title: Top Banana
synopsis: Michael puts George Michael in charge of the Bluth Frozen Banana Stand, and his son subsequently burns down the stand. Elsewhere, Tobias auditions for a commercial, and Lindsay inadvertently gets the part.
fun_fact: In this episode, when we see Michael's yearbook photo, the female student awarded "Most likely to succeed" is named "Ming Hsu." Victor Hsu was a producer for season one of the series.

title: Bringing Up Buster
synopsis: Michael spends quality time with Buster. George Michael auditions for a school play to get closer to Maeby. G.O.B. breaks up with his girlfriend and has nowhere to go.

title: Key Decisions
synopsis: G.O.B. decides to lock himself in his father's prison for 24 hours to get back in with the alliance, and to spend quality time with his father. Michael takes G.O.B.'s girlfriend to an awards show, and Buster inadvertently flirts with his mother's rival.
fun_fact: Lindsay mentions that Tobias is at a stage-fighting workshop with Carl Weathers. When Tobias meets Carl in Public Relations,  he mentions this workshop.

title: Charity Drive
synopsis: Michael and Lindsay try to prove their charitable sides to each other. G.O.B. demands George Michael's respect, and Buster continues avoiding Lucille 2.

title: Visiting Ours
synopsis: Michael sets up an "intimate conjugal visit" for his parents, while it is revealed that George Sr. had an affair with Kitty, his secretary who recently slept with G.O.B.. Tobias and Lindsay see a marriage counselor.

title: In God We Trust
synopsis: Michael attempts to fire the family's incompetent but likable attorney. George Michael impresses Maeby with a muscle suit for a "Living Classics" pageant. Tobias has a psychological affliction where he is unable to take off his clothes.
fun_fact: When Michael returns from the first failed surprise dinner with his mother, his siblings are watching the television show My Mother the Car.

title: My Mother, the Car
synopsis: Michael loses his short-term memory, which Lucille uses to her advantage. G.O.B. attempts to use the family yacht before Michael sells it. George Michael and Maeby attempt to see an R-rated movie about cousins having an affair. Buster and Lucille 2 take "the next step".

title: Storming the Castle
synopsis: Michael cannot go through with his plan to break up G.O.B. and Marta. A thug magician wants to take G.O.B.'s "legs". Maeby wears all leather to get back at her mother, and Lucille decides to confront Buster's relationship with Lucille 2.

title: Pier Pressure
synopsis: Buster realizes that medical marijuana will help cure Lucille 2's vertigo, and pays George Michael to get it for him from G.O.B.. Lindsay sends Maeby to spend a day with Lucille to punish her for bad grades. Michael thinks George Michael is on drugs and attempts to teach him a lesson.

title: Public Relations
synopsis: When George Michael is rejected by a private school due to the family's reputation, Michael hires a publicist from his gym who he's been flirting with to change the public perspective of the Bluths. Meanwhile, Tobias is sent to Boston to reclaim his medical license.
fun_fact: The two newspapers we see in this episode have some extra information. The first time we see a paper (with the headline "Bluth Matron In Brawl At Klimpy's Family Style Restaurant") another article on the page is titled "Musician sues restaurant over use of name." This is a reference to the show being sued by the hip-hop group Arrested Development. || The second newspaper we see has the headline "Bum Gets Balloon." Earlier in the episode, George Michael says that he got a bum away from the banana stand without hurting his feelings, and we briefly see the bum holding a balloon.

title: Marta Complex
synopsis: When Lucille throws an anniversary party for Tobias and Lindsay on Valentine's Day, Michael gives an impassioned speech about love. This makes Marta realize she has feelings for him and Lindsay realize she wants a divorce. Buster decides to move out of the penthouse.
fun_fact: In this episode, both Gob and Lucille attempt to eavesdrop on a telephone call, but with someone making noise in the background.

title: Beef Consommé
synopsis: After learning that Marta has feelings for him, Michael goes to her and they decide to get permission from G.O.B. before taking things to the next level. Meanwhile, Lindsay and Tobias finally get to the heart of his "never-nude" problem and George Sr. faces his first hearing.
fun_fact: When Gob and Buster are talking in the kitchen during this episode, we can see a note on the fridge over Buster's shoulder that reads "I finished the milk. Will buy more. George Michael." This is a reference to the episode Pier Pressure, where we learn that the first J. Walter Weatherman lesson that George Sr. taught his children was about leaving a note about finishing the milk.

title: Shock and Aww
synopsis: Michael falls for George Michael's ethics teacher, Miss Baerly, whom his son also has a crush on. Meanwhile, Lucille adopts a 14-year-old Korean boy, and George Sr.'s "Caged Wisdom" tapes have given him a new admirer.
fun_fact: Although we will not meet Surely Fünke until Altar Egos, in this episode a poster with a picture of Maeby in a wheelchair can be seen hanging in the hallway of George Michael and Maeby's school. It reads "Hold on Surely Fünke!" || Early on in this episode, we learn that Mr. Daniels has had a stroke.  Later, Maeby mentions that she asked him to the dance. "He got all out of breath and dropped the phone. I never heard back."

title: Staff Infection
synopsis: When Michael discovers his family has been receiving paychecks without working, he forces them all to get jobs within the company. Lindsay questions his management skills, and Tobias checks himself in at George Sr.'s prison to research a film role.
fun_fact: Michael refers to the staff as sheep. When we see the staff as a group, there is often a man in a black shirt lagging behind the rest—the black sheep. || Warden Gentles, played by James Lipton, describes himself as "an appreciator of the arts." Lipton is best known as the host of Bravo's Inside the Actors Studio.

title: Altar Egos
synopsis: Michael attempts to have a one-night stand with an attorney whom he doesn't know is blind. G.O.B. gets married on a dare, Maeby pretends to be a girl with a made up disease, and George Sr.'s admirer turns out to be an undercover SEC agent who has truly fallen for him.
fun_fact: George Sr. first mentions that he has a twin brother in this episode.

title: Justice Is Blind
synopsis: G.O.B. steals a file on the government's case against the Bluth Company that Maggie had given to Michael. Tobias is sent to Maggie's house to get evidence, George Michael tries to prove Maeby's fraud, and Lindsay fights to remove the Ten Commandments from the courthouse lawn.
fun_fact: The first reference to a hook is found in this episode. In Michael's flashback to an elementary school play in which Captain Hook is put on trial, the captain's hook falls off. We learn in episode Motherboy XXX that Buster played Captain Hook. || Maggie Lizer introduces herself as "Maggie lies her ass off" — one of the few things she's actually honest about. || Henry Winkler combs his hair in the same way that he did when he portrayed the Fonz on Happy Days.

title: Missing Kitty
synopsis: G.O.B. attempts to make good on his promise to make the family yacht disappear. Lindsay and Maeby try to track down Lindsay's grandmother, Tobias seeks George Sr.'s respect, and Michael attempts to fire Kitty, who claims to have information that could bring down the company.
fun_fact: After sleeping with Michael, Maggie Lizer mentions that it's "the second most unethical thing she's ever done." Later in the episode, we learn the most unethical thing she's ever done—pretending to be blind to cheat on the LSAT.

title: Best Man for the Gob
synopsis: George Sr. uses G.O.B.'s bachelor party as an opportunity to set up his accountant in a compromising position so that he can blackmail him. Meanwhile, Michael tries to prove he's a fun guy, and the Fünke's reunite their family folk-music band.

title: Whistler's Mother
synopsis: Michael deals with numerous requests for some unfrozen money, and chastises Lucille for being too coddling with Buster. Also, Lindsay decides to protest the war to boost her self esteem, Tobias and G.O.B. decide to start a coffee company.
fun_fact: When Oscar first meets with Michael, he mentions a song he wrote called "All You Need Are Smiles." At the end of the episode, Oscar uses this song in an attempt to woo Lucille. || Oscar's text message alert tone is the Banana Grabber saying "Look, a seagull!"

title: Not Without My Daughter
synopsis: Michael takes Maeby to work with him on Take Your Daughter to Work Day. After being slighted by Michael, Tobias, George Michael and G.O.B. all go to the mall to prove that they are just manly. Oscar takes Lucille and Buster to Annyong's soccer game.

title: Let 'Em Eat Cake
synopsis: In the first season finale, George Sr. has a heart attack, and Maeby is jealous when George Michael likes another girl. Meanwhile, Lindsay decides to leave Tobias until a book he wrote a long time ago becomes a gay bestseller, and Buster and Annyong compete over women.
fun_fact: Ann is played by Alessandra Torresani in this episode; in all other episodes, Mae Whitman plays Ann. || Barry's gay assistant is at Tobias's reading of The Man Inside Me.

title: The One Where Michael Leaves
synopsis: George Sr. is at large, making Michael next in line to be prosecuted for the Bluth Company crimes. Meanwhile, Michael is vexed to find that the family is fine without him, and police mistake Oscar for George Sr. and arrest him.
fun_fact: Michael tells George Michael that Lindsay had a nose job when she was young. For the rest of the episode, George Michael can be seen examining Lindsay's nose, and Lindsay acting self-conscious when she notices George Michael doing it.

title: The One Where They Build a House
synopsis: Michael is driven crazy by G.O.B. when he impresses the board as the new company figurehead due to Michael's legal troubles. Meanwhile, George Sr. is arrested in Mexico for a crime Oscar committed, and Buster witnesses something that utterly shocks him.
fun_fact: When George Sr. is arrested in Mexico, he, like the rest of his family, is unable to come up with the Spanish word for "brother." || The poster for Tom Jane's movie Junk says "From the directors of Dangerous Cousins."

title: ¡Amigos!
synopsis: Michael is increasingly frustrated over being abandoned by the family, and when the staircar is found in Mexico, Michael vows to find his father and give him a piece of his mind. Also, Buster spends time with Lupe's family and thinks he's in Mexico.
fun_fact: After a miscommunication about who is taking which car to get back to the US, the narrator says, "At no point were Michael and Maeby talking about the same person, and there were only four people in their group." There were five people in their group—the narrator has forgotten about Ann. || The posters in Gob's office reflect exactly the opposite of his attitude—when a poster that says "Never Give Up" falls, Gob says, "Fuck it, just leave it where it is." This also happens with Michael: after talking to George Michael on the phone about Ann, there is a poster over his shoulder that reads "Keep An Open Mind." When he hangs up, he immediately tells Gob that he doesn't like Ann.

title: Good Grief
synopsis: Lucille hires Ice, the bounty hunter to find George Sr., who may be closer than everyone thinks. G.O.B. tries to pull off an elaborate illusion, Maeby tries to set Lindsay up with Ice, and Michael tries to mend George Michael's broken relationship.
fun_fact: This episode has a number of Charlie Brown references. Among them: George Michael, George Sr., Tobias, and Gob all do a sad walk based on Charlie Brown, and when George Michael first does it, he passes a red dog house with a dog on top of it.

title: Sad Sack
synopsis: George Sr. fears he's losing Lucille to Oscar; G.O.B. motivates Buster for the Army; Lindsay spends more time with Maeby to get closer to Steve Holt; Tobias starts working out.
fun_fact: In this episode, we learn that Michael's dead wife's name is "Tracy." Previously, in a flashback, Michael says that if he doesn't do well in a math class "Tracy will never marry him." || When Tobias takes a picture of his "Iraqi landscape" in the bathtub, the phone (Gob's phone) plays "The Final Countdown."

title: Afternoon Delight
synopsis: G.O.B. stages mass firings after being inadvertently roasted at the Bluth Company Christmas party. Plus, Michael is forced to rebuild the Banana Stand, and Buster plays hooky from the Army at an arcade game.
fun_fact: The first hint of Annyong's true motives can be found in this episode. When the banana stand is pulled out of the harbor, the graffiti on the side reads, "... get u Bluths" and is signed "Hello." || This episode is the only one in the series directed by Jason Bateman (Michael Bluth).

title: Switch Hitter
synopsis: The Bluth's rival development company hires G.O.B., who finds the company president a father figure, in preparation for the Bluth-Sitwell softball game; Lindsay hallucinates from taking anti-depressants.
fun_fact: Early in this episode, Lindsay takes Teamocil and immediately forgets having taken it. Later, we learn that memory loss is one of the side effects of the drug.

title: Queen for a Day
synopsis: Michael sells a portion of his stock in the Bluth Company to buy a car, and Lucille 2 returns, only to discover that Buster is dating the company secretary Starla.
fun_fact: While in the gay bar, someone sings "New York, New York" by Frank Sinatra, and Lucille Austero says, "Everyone thinks they're Sinatra." In 1977, Liza Minnelli starred in a movie called New York, New York in which she performed said song. || Michael makes mention of the Veals being "all penned up."

title: Burning Love
synopsis: Michael reunites with his long, lost love Sally Sitwell, but faces interference from parents; meanwhile, the two Lucilles need someone to bid on them at the bachelorette auction with Buster already in a relationship.
fun_fact: After Tobias announces his intentions to go hunting for a wolf on the loose to impress Lindsay, he leaves the room, and says in passing to Gob, "I'm going hunting for my wife!" Later, Tobias will tranquilize his wife instead of the wolf.

title: Ready, Aim, Marry Me
synopsis: With the company in dire financial straits and the Bluths no longer the primary shareholders, Michael must turn to old family friend "Uncle" Jack Dorso for financial assistance. Uncle Jack, however, wants something in return.
fun_fact: In Righteous Brothers, which features an American remake of Les Cousins Dangereux, the narrator points out that the film is ruined by a constant disclaimer that the two characters aren't really cousins. Throughout this episode, the narrator points out that Uncle Jack isn't actually related to the Bluths. || Jack Dorso is loosely inspired by Jack LaLanne.

title: Out on a Limb
synopsis: Just as Michael's relationship with Sally Sitwell starts to flourish, Maggie Lizer returns nine months pregnant, and Michael immediately assumes he's the father; also, George Michael attempts to break up with Ann, and Buster learns he's being deployed to Iraq.

title: Hand to God
synopsis: Michael tries to find out who's the father of Maggie's baby, or if it's just another of her lies; G.O.B. tries to find out whether he was responsible for Buster's accident.
fun_fact: At the end of this episode, it would appear that Maggie Lizer really is pregnant, but we don't hear anything more about this in the remaining episodes of the first three seasons.

title: Motherboy XXX
synopsis: Lucille abducts George Michael for a mother-son dance; Buster adjusts to having a hook for a hand; G.O.B. reunites with his estranged wife; Tobias stars as George Sr. in a biopic about the Bluth family, which causes Lindsay to become more attracted to him.
fun_fact: Barry literally "jumps the shark" in this episode, an allusion to Happy Days, where his character, the Fonz, jumps over a shark. The phrase has come to signify the point at which a television show's quality has begun to decrease beyond repair. This episode of Arrested Development features extensive product placement by Burger King, a fact that Barry mentions immediately before he jumps the shark. || The narrator notes that Motherboy is distinct from a heavy metal band that used to "rock pretty hard" back in the 70s, and that they are "legally obligated to make the distinction"—this again references a lawsuit filed by the early 90s hip-hop group Arrested Development against the TV show.

title: The Immaculate Election
synopsis: George Michael runs for student body president, which G.O.B. manages to ruin; Buster has an affair with Lupe, who is being sought after by Lindsay; Tobias attempts to move out of the model home, then develops a new persona when he regrets his decision.
fun_fact: The cameraman for Gob's video in this episode is Gary the "poof." || Buster records himself re-enacting both George Michael's Star Wars Kid video and his other favorite, Chicago—a production in which Liza Minnelli starred on Broadway.

title: Sword of Destiny
synopsis: G.O.B. and Buster team up for some magic illusions to impress Tony Wonder, a rival magician. Meanwhile, Michael is forced to delegate some work when he's hospitalized and Lindsay teaches George Michael how to drive using the staircar.
fun_fact: Tony Wonder mentions that a band already has the rights to the title Use Your Illusion; as in Motherboy XXX, this is presumably a reference to the lawsuit by hip-hop group Arrested Development.

title: Meat the Veals
synopsis: George Sr. tries to find a way to attend an anniversary dinner for Lucille; Michael deliberatly offends Ann's devout Christian parents; Tobias goes overboard performing his "Mrs. Featherbottom" persona.

title: Spring Breakout
synopsis: G.O.B. confronts the editor of the videos that showcased his magic mistakes; Michael tricks Lucille in to rehab, and then attempts to get her out after George Sr. is kidnapped.
fun_fact: Tobias is in the fireplace throughout this episode, and only "comes out" at the prospect of being flashed by men.

title: Righteous Brothers
synopsis: G.O.B. hides George Sr. while the model home's plumbing is checked; George Michael helps Ann protest Maeby's new movie; Tobias takes a liking to Kitty after Michael asks him to keep an eye on her.

title: The Cabin Show
synopsis: Michael postpones camping with his son to look for his father in Reno. Meanwhile, Lucille goes off her medication; G.O.B. meets a fellow disappointed son; and Maeby and George Michael can't help being thrown together.
fun_fact: Michael and George Michael wake up on the floor next to each other like they did at the beginning of the pilot. || After we learn that Maeby and Steve Holt are cousins, they make out.

title: For British Eyes Only
synopsis: Investigating his father's claim that a British group set him up, Michael goes to "Wee Britain" and is smitten with a beautiful woman named Rita. Lindsay attempts to seduce the new family attorney, and G.O.B. goes to extremes to avoid his newly discovered son.
fun_fact: The Bluth family publicist, Jessie, calls George Michael "Opie," a character from The Andy Griffith Show. Later, after Andy Griffith has apparently declined to serve as part of George Sr.'s legal team, the narrator will clarify that "no one was making fun of Andy Griffith."

title: Forget-Me-Now
synopsis: Michael tries to hide Rita from his family with disastrous results; Lindsay waits hand and foot on the Bluths' new lawyer; George Sr. attempts escaping via balloons; Tobias tries to help Buster gain some self-confidence; George Michael confronts Steve Holt about Maeby.
fun_fact: Gob calls George Michael a pothead in this episode, a reference to the episode Pier Pressure, where George Michael asks Gob to buy him marijuana.

title: Notapusy
synopsis: Michael enters a father-son triathlon with Steve Holt; Maeby dons a disguise to compete in an inner-beauty pageant while her parents coach other entrants; George Sr. speaks to at-risk youths, and Buster tries to recruit one to replace him in the Army.
fun_fact: In the war scene that serves as an excuse to say "pussy," the nurse who appears with Buster will later appear as Adelaide, Buster's nurse when he fakes a coma.

title: Mr. F
synopsis: Moles underground alert the Bluths to a mole in their company; Tobias mistakes a CIA agent for a theatrical one.
fun_fact: At a meeting in the Bluth boardroom, there is mention of a possible mole and a "listening device"—the camera cuts dramatically between the people in the room, ending on a wide shot where we can see a boom mic dip into frame briefly. || The water tower in Tiny Town reads "Sudden Hill," mirroring the name of the Bluth housing development, "Sudden Valley."

title: The Ocean Walker
synopsis: Michael's parents disapprove of him marrying Rita until a revelation from her uncle.
fun_fact: It is mentioned in passing that Rita's parents are cousins. || The image we're shown of Rita before plastic surgery shows Charlize Theron as Aileen Wuornos, her Academy Award-winning role in Monster.

title: Prison Break-In
synopsis: Michael is worried when he learns that Lucille is dating the warden behind his father's back; Buster's new turtle gets into "Uncle-Father" Oscar's stash; the family plans a benefit for Tobias' life-endangering hair transplant.
fun_fact: A number of lines in this episode are about the Fox television show Prison Break, which had done very well in Arrested Development's timeslot. Among them, Tobias's use of the moniker "T-bag."

title: Making a Stand
synopsis: Michael and G.O.B. set out to teach their father a lesson for his years of pitting them against each other; Lindsay and Tobias compete over Bob Loblaw; Lucille's post-op appearance inspires Maeby.
fun_fact: The title on the cover of one of the videos is Backseat Boyfights: The Trip to Uncle Jack's 70th, a reference to Uncle Jack from Ready, Aim, Marry Me.

title: S.O.B.s
synopsis: The Bluths try to save themselves with a party featuring Andy Richter, whose quintuplet brother teaches George Michael; G.O.B. accidentally lands a job.
fun_fact: This episode spoofs sensational television gimmicks to increase rates and avoid cancellation. They "pull out all of the stops," making use of 3D glasses, a wind-up at the intro with a death, and references to selling the show to HBO or Showtime.

title: Fakin' It
synopsis: Judge Reinhold presides over George Sr.'s mock trial, and Michael worries about a surprise witness. Meanwhile, a coma keeps Buster from testifying.
fun_fact: When Michael tells Wayne Jarvis that the Bluth family doesn't cut and run, we can see Maeby fleeing the altar in the background.

title: Family Ties
synopsis: When Michael hires a woman who may be his sister, her services might be just what the company needs. Meanwhile, Buster's coma attracts the attention of a politician.
fun_fact: After Lindsay and Tobias turn down "Girl" Michael for a "Holy Trinity," "Girl" Michael mentions that they're "still going to have to pay Frank." It would appear that Franklin is also "Girl" Michael's pimp.

title: Exit Strategy
synopsis: The Bluth boys find a web of mass deception in Iraq when Michael and Buster rescue G.O.B., who was imprisoned while on a USO tour. Meanwhile, George Michael plans a Sweet 16 surprise party for Maeby.
fun_fact: At the end of the episode, we see "Baghdad" written in the hills in Arabic. However, the letters are written left to right instead of right to left, and they aren't connected as they should be. || One of the Saddam Hussein impersonators says that they "wanted to keep the house for just one more season," a reference to the show being cancelled.

writer: Richard Day, Mitchell Hurwitz, Chuck Tatham, & Jim Vallely
title: Development Arrested
synopsis: Lucille throws a yacht party to celebrate the family's recent success, but the Bluths learn the sailing is still far from smooth.
fun_fact: Michael asks George Michael how long his infatuation with Maeby has been going on. Geroge Michael replies, "I dunno. 53 weeks?" This is the 53rd episode of the series. || When discussing Lindsay's adoption, Lucille says they went through with it just to "stick it" to Stan Sitwell. It has previously been mentioned that, in high school, Sally Sitwell was called "Sally Stickwell" because all the boys wanted to stick it to her.
